business.headline: Rs 1 crore in 5 years: Check this guide for 40-year-olds earning Rs 2.5 lakh/monthIf you're earning Rs 2.5 lakh a month, building a corpus of Rs 1 crore in just five years may sound ambitious, but it's certainly achievable with the right planning, discipline, and smart investments.
India likely to become a $30 trillion economy by 2047, says Amitabh KantAt present, India's economy is valued at around $4 trillion. It recently became the fourth largest economy in the world.

Tesla not ready to Make in India, says Union Minister: ReportThe Union Minister said that Tesla is not expected to begin manufacturing vehicles in India in the near future. He mentioned that the company is currently interested only in opening showrooms in the country.
Sensex closes 77 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Adani Ports gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 77.26 points to close at 81,373.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.10 points to end at 24,716.60.

EPFO extends UAN-Aadhaar linking deadline for ELI scheme to June 30. Check stepsAs per a recent circular issued by the EPFO, the new last date to activate your UAN and link your Aadhaar-linked bank account is June 30, 2025. This deadline has already been pushed back several times, giving employees extra time to complete the process.

Reliance Power shares surge 8% today, 23% in last week. Should you buy?Reliance Power share price: Over the last six months, it has gone up by 59.92%. The stock has more than doubled in a year with a 141.40% rise. Over the last five years, the rise has been massive; 2,602.61%.

Living paycheck to paycheck: Analyst says India has worst family financial planningAn analyst said that in 2025 we need to teach kids not just how to earn money but how to manage it. He pointed out a common but dangerous mindset, the one with no room for budgeting, risk awareness, or financial learning.

RBI MPC: 25 bps rate cut on the cards? Here's all you need to knowSo far in 2025, the RBI has already cut the repo rate twice, once in February and then in April, by 25 bps each time. These cuts brought the key lending rate down to 6%.

NPS pensioners to get more benefits under Unified Pension Scheme. Details hereEligible NPS retirees can either get a one-time payment based on their last drawn Basic Pay and Dearness Allowance (DA) for every six months of service, or receive a monthly top-up if their current pension is less than what they'd get under UPS with Dearness Relief.

Leela Hotels share price: Stock lists at 7% discount on Dalal StreetThe company's stock opened at Rs 406 on the NSE, which is Rs 29 below the issue price of Rs 435. On the BSE, it opened slightly higher at Rs 406.50, still lower by Rs 28.50, or about 6.55%.

Sensex tumbles 700 points. Why is stock market falling despite strong GDP growth?The BSE Sensex was down 732.71 points to 80,718.30 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 197.45 points lower at 24,553.25. Most of the broader market indices also fell sharply amid a surge in volatility.

Leela Hotels vs Aegis Vopak listing: Which IPO will make stronger market debut?Leela Hotels and Aegis Vopak had their initial public offerings (IPOs) open for subscription from May 26 to May 28. While both IPOs were fully subscribed, they did not see very high demand during the bidding period.

entertainment.headline: Actor Sooraj Pancholi says Bollywood is caught in a vicious cycleActor Sooraj Pancholi spoke about Bollywood's vicious cycle and self-destruction. He urged kindness and unity to save the industry from further downfall.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday tease youthful romance in Tu Meri Main…first lookKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday hinted at a youthful love story in the first look poster from their upcoming film, 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri'. The film is slated to hit the screens in February 2026.

Anushka Shetty's Ghaati to release in theatres in July 2025, new poster outAfter facing multiple delays, 'Ghaati', the much-awaited action-crime drama starring actor Anushka Shetty is set for a release on July 11.

Cinematographer Pratik to exit Ganguly biopic amid sexual misconduct row: ReportCinematographer Pratik Shah, who has been accused of sexual harassment based on testimonies of multiple women, is likely to be dropped from the Sourav Ganguly biopic, suggested reports.

BTS countdown 2025: Discharge dates, comeback clues, OT7 reunion buzzBTS begins their reunion as members complete military service this June. A comeback is expected soon, with 2025 full-group plans underway. Their FESTA skit revealed the theme Twelve O'Clock, symbolising new beginnings for ARMY.

Shabana Azmi shares adorable throwback with betu Farhan AkhtarVeteran actor Shabana Azmi shared a heartwarming throwback photo with Farhan Akhtar. The photo was from Farhan's wedding with Shibani Dandekar in 2022.

Neeraj Ghaywan shares Homebound was inspired by powerful pandemic-era true storyDirector Neeraj Ghaywan shared a series of posts on X and revealed that his film 'Homebound' is inspired by a powerful pandemic-era true story. He even thanked the entire team for their efforts behind the film.

Radhika Apte on how industry isn't conducive to new mothers: It's really difficultRadhika Apte recently opened up about the challenges faced by new mothers in the Indian film industry and navigating family time amid her work schedule.

Why Mahesh Babu's Khaleja is finally getting the love it missed 15 years agoFifteen years after its original release, Khaleja is winning hearts with its re-release. The film's unique story and memorable performances have finally found the appreciation they deserve.

Virat Kohli's cute confession about Anushka Sharma in Dubai ad makes fans blushAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have teamed for a new campaign promoting Dubai Tourism. While the couple highlight the city's attractions through the promotional film, their chemistry is just unmissable.

Ajay Devgn, Kajol and mansplaining in full view: It wasn't his question to answerIn the full view of the media, actor Ajay Devgn answered a question which was addressed to Kajol, at the trailer launch of 'Maa'. Here's just saying that when a woman is asked about her experience, let her speak. Don't take the mic, or her moment!

Pankaj Tripathi reacts to his viral AI image as Baburao Apte amid Hera Pheri 3 buzzPankaj Tripathi has responded to viral AI-generated images depicting him as Baburao from Hera Pheri', calling technology both a boon and a curse. The actor emphasised the importance of mindful use of AI.

Good Boy's Park Bo-gum, Lee Sang-yi are ready for India, Bollywood'Good Boy' stars Park Bo-gum and Lee Sang-yi share their enthusiasm for India and Bollywood projects. Their visit could strengthen cultural ties and expand K-drama's influence in India.

Regular gaun ya naak se? Himesh Reshammiya's quirky dig at Mumbai concertSinger Himesh Reshammiya stirred nostalgia with his performance on his hit track as a part of his Cap Mania Tour in Mumbai. During the concert, he playfully addressed his nasal singing style.

Actor Parambrata Chattopadhyay, wife Piya welcome baby boy: Our hearts are fullActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay and wife Piya Chakraborty have welcomed their first child, a baby boy, in Kolkata. Parambrata shared the good news with his fans on social media.

Aryan Khan enjoys a game of paddle tennis with friends. WatchShah Rukh Khan's son, Aryan, recently enjoyed a game of paddle tennis with friends in Mumbai. A video of him playing the friendly match has gone viral.

Rejections to winning Roadies XX, the underdog story of Gullu from Elvish's teamKushal Tanwar, aka Gullu, from Elvish Yadav's team won 'MTV Roadies XX (Double Cross)'. Here's a glimpse into his dramatic journey from facing rejections to finally gaining fame.

Pakistan army uses Kashmir to line their pockets, looting nation: Adnan SamiAdnan Sami spoke about Pakistan, its army and the people who are suffering because of the establishment. The singer shared that the army is exploiting the Kashmir issue in front of the world.

I'll work as long as I can: Clint Eastwood is not retiring even at 95At 95, Hollywood director Clint Eastwood says he has no plans to retire and is already working on his next film. He believes in continuous learning and creating original stories, rather than relying on remakes or sequels.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor delegations to meet PM next week, brief him about outreachThe delegations, comprising Members of Parliament from across the political spectrum, senior political leaders, and seasoned diplomats, were tasked with engaging the international community to present India's position and garner global support for its fight against terrorism.

Salman Khurshid drops cryptic post amid Op Sindoor outreach duty; jab at Congress?Senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid questioned why it was difficult to be patriotic when the all-party delegations were on a mission to convey India's anti-terrorism stance.

Russia-Ukraine peace talks end within an hour day after Moscow aircraft hitThe mood in Russia was angry as the talks kicked off, with influential war bloggers calling on Moscow to deliver a fearsome retaliatory blow against Kyiv after Ukraine on Sunday launched one of its most ambitious attacks of the war, targeting Russian nuclear-capable long-range bombers in Siberia and elsewhere.

Anti-Hasina warriors get tax relief like 1971 freedom fightersBangladesh's interim government of Muhammad Yunus has granted personal tax exemption for income of up to 5.25 lakh taka to wounded 'July Warriors' — the protesters who took part in the agitation against Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. The war-wounded freedom fighters of the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War will also get a similar tax exemption.

Ranchi-bound IndiGo flight suffers bird hit at 4,000 feet, makes emergency landingAn IndiGo flight coming from Patna to Ranchi had to make an emergency landing after it was hit by a vulture midair. All passengers and crew on-board are safe.

Chirag Paswan's Bihar bid: Pressure tactic on BJP or strategy to replace Nitish?Chirag Paswan's growing push to contest the Bihar assembly elections from a general seat signals his ambition to shift from national to state politics, potentially eyeing the Chief Minister's post.

India preparing for similar scenarios: Expert on Ukraine's drone strikes on RussiaReacting to Ukraine's Operation Spider's Web, in which Kyiv targeted Russian airbases, ammunition, explosives and UAV expert Col Devesh Singh (retd) said India was preparing for future conflicts in similar scenarios with FPV drones, counter drones and air defence innovations.

Why did summer end before it began in 2025?As May 2025 unfolded, instead of the expected peak summer heat, large parts of India experienced comparatively cooler temperatures, and less number of heatwave days marked by unseasonal rains and thunderstorms.
Watch: Mount Etna's gigantic eruption caught on cameraThe eruption produced a significant pyroclastic flow—a fast-moving current of hot gas, ash, and volcanic rock—emanating from the central crater.

Russia's Pearl Harbour moment: 5 takeaways from Ukraine's stunning attackUkrainian special forces executed one of the largest and most complex drone-based special operations in modern warfare, destroying 41 Russian aircraft across multiple airbases using over 100 drones launched from disguised shipping containers.

NEET PG 2025 postponed after Supreme Court directs exam to be held in single shiftNEET PG 2025 has been postponed after the Supreme Court directed that the exam must be held in a single shift. The decision was made to ensure transparency and fairness for all candidates.

Who will take the IPL 2025 trophy? Stats show RCB and Punjab Kings are neck and neckIn 18 years of IPL history, both teams have played 36 matches against each other, with a victory rate of 50 per cent.

Ajay Devgn, Kajol and mansplaining in full view: It wasn't his question to answerIn the full view of the media, actor Ajay Devgn answered a question which was addressed to Kajol, at the trailer launch of 'Maa'. Here's just saying that when a woman is asked about her experience, let her speak. Don't take the mic, or her moment!

I'm pregnant, was worried: Woman who hit auto driver with slippers apologisesA woman who attacked a Bengaluru autorickshaw driver with her slipper during an altercation publicly apologised on Sunday. She defended herself, saying she was afraid of having a miscarriage and expressed her love for the city and Kannada culture.

Indian vlogger held in Turkey for sexual remarks; deletes clip, apologisesAn Indian vlogger was reportedly detained in Turkey after videos of him making sexually explicit remarks about Turkish women surfaced. Malik SD Khan, popular as Malik Swashbuckler, issued a video apology to Turkish women. It wasn't clear if the video was made while he was in custody.

Tamil Nadu pastor assaults sons for playing with Hindu child, arrestedA pastor in Tamil Nadu's Kanyakumari district was arrested for beating his young sons. He assaulted his young sons allegedly for playing with a Hindu child.

How a Harvard-educated Admiral planned Pearl Harbour attack on USUkraine covertly transported drones deep inside Russian territory and used them to destroy over 40 bomber planes. It was branded the "modern Pearl Harbour" moment by Russian media and experts. This is all about the original Pearl Harbour attack by the Japanese on the US fleet that changed the course of WWII, and history.

Anger boils over in POK; thousands block China-Pak highway for 3 daysPushed to the brink, thousands of residents of Pakistan-occupied Gilgit-Baltistan have launched an indefinite blockade of the China-Pakistan Karakoram Highway, protesting the Shehbaz Sharif government's trade policies. While the government was negotiating with terrorists, it failed to talk to traders, said a leader of Sharif's party.

Let him go to court, no theatre will screen Thug Life: Karnataka film body chiefEven though Kamal Haasan has moved court seeking protection for his film Thug Life's release, the Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce said no theatres in the state would screen the film unless he apologises for his remark.

Chant Hanuman Chalisa, comedian tells Pak audience member in viral video. IYKYKComedian Gaurav Gupta recently took a jibe at a Pakistani fan during a stand-up show as part of his US-Canada comedy tour, which led to mixed reactions.

Garbage buried in Kasol forest after viral video of waste triggers outrageA viral video exposing months of unchecked garbage dumping in Himachal Pradesh's Kasol wildlife sanctuary sparked public outrage. Authorities hastily buried city waste deep in the forest in violation of environmental laws, without treating them.

Very proud of him: Elon Musk's father on his contributions to DOGEIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, expressed pride in his son's work with DOGE and thanked Donald Trump.

Tesla not ready to Make in India, says Union Minister: ReportThe Union Minister said that Tesla is not expected to begin manufacturing vehicles in India in the near future. He mentioned that the company is currently interested only in opening showrooms in the country.

Autistic brothers assaulted, burnt with cigarettes at Dehradun boarding schoolA mother in Dehradun has alleged that her two autistic sons were sexually assaulted, beaten, and tortured by a hostel caretaker at an illegal boarding school.

sports.headline: We will try and win IPL 2025 for Virat Kohli: RCB captain Rajat PatidarRajat Patidar said that RCB will be looking to win the IPL 2025 title for Virat Kohli ahead of the final against PBKS on Tuesday, June 3. Kohli has been the star with the bat for RCB this season.

England to host Women's T20 World Cup 2026: Dates and venues confirmedThe ICC has announced the dates for the upcoming Women's T20 World Cup 2026, which will be hosted in England from June 12 to July 5, featuring 33 matches across seven iconic venues.

Retired players have no hatred towards Virat Kohli: Robin Uthappa slams fanRobin Uthappa claimed that former players don't have any bias towards Virat Kohli and it is ok for them to disagree with the RCB star at times. Kohli has been the main man for RCB this season.

IPL final venue change not politically motivated: BCCI's Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has dismissed claims that the IPL 2025 final and Qualifier 2 were moved out of Kolkata due to political reasons. He insisted weather and logistical challenges were the sole factors behind the venue change.

Watch: Shreyas' sister mimics his swag walk, PBKS skipper celebrates with momShreyas Iyer's sister imitated his swag walk while the PBKS skipper celebrated with his mother after the Qualifier 2 win over MI on June 1. Shreyas led from the front for PBKS against MI.

India, Sri Lanka to host Women's ODI World Cup from September 30 to November 2The 13th edition of the ICC Women's 50-over World Cup will take place from September 30 to November 2, with matches held across five venues in India and Sri Lanka, featuring eight participating teams.

French Open: Gauff makes it to 5th straight quarterfinal, Andreeva advancesCoco Gauff made it to her fifth straight quarterfinal at the French Open after overcoming a spirited second-set performance from Ekaterina Alexandrova on Monday, June 2. Mirra Andreeva also defeated Daria Kasatkina to progress to the final 8.

Stuart Broad joins South Africa as bowling consultant ahead of WTC FinalFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad will join the South African squad as a consultant to assist with their preparations for this month's World Test Championship Final.

How Punjab Kings took down Jasprit Bumrah in Qualifier 2, James Hopes revealsPunjab Kings (PBKS) bowling coach James Hopes opened up on Josh Inglis' mindset after he took down Jasprit Bumrah in the Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Mumbai Indians (MI).

IPL Final: Rain likely in Ahmedabad, as fans ready to crown new championThe Indian Premier League 2025 final is likely to be affected by rain, predicts the weather department in Ahmedabad. The conditions are expected to be cloudy throughout, aiding the fast bowlers.

Heinrich Klaasen announces shocking retirement from international cricketSouth Africa star wicketkeeper-batter Heinrich Klaasen has shocked the cricketing world by announcing his sudden retirement from international cricket, bringing an unexpected end to a career marked by explosive hitting and calm, match-winning presence.

French Open: Gauff makes it to 5th straight quarterfinal, Andreeva advancesCoco Gauff made it to her fifth straight quarterfinal at the French Open after overcoming a spirited second-set performance from Ekaterina Alexandrova on Monday, June 2. Mirra Andreeva also defeated Daria Kasatkina to progress to the final 8.

Stuart Broad joins South Africa as bowling consultant ahead of WTC FinalFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad will join the South African squad as a consultant to assist with their preparations for this month's World Test Championship Final.

How Punjab Kings took down Jasprit Bumrah in Qualifier 2, James Hopes revealsPunjab Kings (PBKS) bowling coach James Hopes opened up on Josh Inglis' mindset after he took down Jasprit Bumrah in the Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Mumbai Indians (MI).

IPL Final: Rain likely in Ahmedabad, as fans ready to crown new championThe Indian Premier League 2025 final is likely to be affected by rain, predicts the weather department in Ahmedabad. The conditions are expected to be cloudy throughout, aiding the fast bowlers.

Heinrich Klaasen announces shocking retirement from international cricketSouth Africa star wicketkeeper-batter Heinrich Klaasen has shocked the cricketing world by announcing his sudden retirement from international cricket, bringing an unexpected end to a career marked by explosive hitting and calm, match-winning presence.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
